perturbation.original_text: 8.4 Privacy. eDiets agrees to treat all consumer data collected from Women.com users on the Women.com Site in accordance with Women.com's privacy and security policies (the "Women.com Data"). Women.com reserves the right to change such policies in its sole discretion from time to time. In no event shall eDiets disclose or otherwise transfer to any person or entity any Women.com Data that individually or in the aggregate identifies the identity, habits or transactions of the Women.com users.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.4 Privacy. eDiets agrees to treat all consumer data collected from Women.com users on the Women.com Site in accordance with Women.com's privacy and security policies (the "Women.com Data"). Women.com reserves the right to change such policies in its sole discretion from time to time. eDiets may disclose or otherwise transfer Women.com Data.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the phrase 'In no event shall eDiets disclose or otherwise transfer to any person or entity any Women.com Data that individually or in the aggregate identifies the identity, habits or transactions of the Women.com users' allows eDiets to share or sell user data without restriction. This contradicts the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and similar privacy laws, which require explicit consent and control over personal data. By omitting the prohibition against disclosing user data, the contract creates a legal loophole that could violate privacy regulations, potentially exposing Women.com to liability.
